A project manager has an opportunity to add a highly skilled expert to the team who can increase the probability of the project's success.
Which of the following risk strategies should the project manager adopt?

discussion.content:
The project manager should adopt the "exploitation" risk strategy in this situation. Therefore, option A is the correct answer.

Exploitation is a risk strategy where the project team takes advantage of positive risks or opportunities to increase the probability of project success. Adding a highly skilled expert to the team is an example of a positive risk or opportunity that can be exploited to improve the project's chances of success.
